page.title: 18OLD AGE - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: On retirement, tenant farmers are offered the use of an estate cottage, unless they can buy one for themselves. One farmer's wife complained of a shortage of available cottages, so many being bought by townspeople, as country homes. Being tenants, farming families tend to furnish with only moveable goods, and the almost universal double glazing, is absent in the farmhouses, despite grumbles about the cold. It is not moveable! The older generation is well cared for by both tenant families and those in private houses. At a cottage near one farm, elderly parents in their late eighties are constantly visited by their children, who do all their shopping. At a much bigger private house, a bungalow has been built for the parents, who are equally well cared for.
